Description: One ear-ring made of shell and eleven beads made in different shapes, all of white faience. A: fragment of an ear-ring made of shell, one end preserved, getting wider towards the other end. B: Four segmented cylindrical beads, longest one has six segments preserved. C: Six disc-shaped beads. D: One well shaped cylindrical bead, partly broken off, the end is rounded like for a pectoral end-bead.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
